name: Pull Quote Spread
description: Large-format editorial quote spanning a significant portion of the page, with oversized quotation marks, the quote text in display typography, and attribution below. Used to break up long narrative sections and highlight key voices or insights.

grid.columns: 3-14 (centered 10 columns) or asymmetric 4-16 (right-weighted with left margin breathing room)
grid.margins: $spacing-09 (48px) above and below the quote block

components: Opening quotation mark: decorative oversized glyph in $blue-60, $display-02 or larger
Quote text: $heading-04 or $heading-05 in $text-01, 2-4 sentences maximum
Attribution line: $body-short-01 in $text-03, format '— Name, Title, Organization'
Optional left border accent: 4px solid $blue-60 on the left edge of the quote block
Optional background: g10 panel behind the entire quote for contrast
rules: Quote text uses $heading-04 or $heading-05 — large enough to command attention but not overwhelm the page
Maximum 4 sentences — pull quotes are highlights, not full testimonials. Trim ruthlessly
Attribution always includes at minimum the speaker's name and title — anonymous quotes lack credibility
Opening quotation mark is decorative, positioned above or to the left of the quote text in $blue-60
Generous vertical spacing: $spacing-09 (48px) above and below ensures the quote breathes
Pull quotes must be centered vertically on their section or have enough surrounding whitespace to feel intentional
If using left border accent (4px $blue-60), do not also use background fill — choose one visual treatment
Pull quote text must be an exact excerpt from the document or a direct stakeholder quote — never fabricated

printBehavior.pagePosition: flexible — use as visual break between dense narrative sections
printBehavior.bleedHandling: no bleed for standard; g10 background extends to column edges if used

accessibilityNotes: Use <blockquote> with <cite> for attribution — semantic quote markup is mandatory
Decorative quotation mark glyph must have aria-hidden='true' — it's visual emphasis, not content

Quote text should not use heading tags — use

with appropriate CSS class to avoid polluting document outline
Ensure $heading-04/$heading-05 text maintains 4.5:1 contrast against any background treatment
antiPatterns: Never use $body-long-01 or $body-short-01 for pull quote text — it must be larger than surrounding body text to justify its presence
Never include more than 4 sentences — long pull quotes become regular paragraphs and lose their impact
Never place two pull quotes on the same page or spread — each one needs dedicated visual real estate
Never omit attribution — unattributed quotes read as editorial opinion rather than credible testimony
Never use pull quotes for generic statements — they should surface surprising, provocative, or data-backed insights
